/home/mgh/LanlGeoMag/libLanlGeoMag/dqagpe.f

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 *DECK DQAGPE
00002       SUBROUTINE DQAGPE (F, A, B, NPTS2, POINTS, EPSABS, EPSREL, LIMIT,
00003      +   RESULT, ABSERR, NEVAL, IER, ALIST, BLIST, RLIST, ELIST, PTS,
00004      +   IORD, LEVEL, NDIN, LAST)
00005 C***BEGIN PROLOGUE  DQAGPE
00006 C***PURPOSE  Approximate a given definite integral I = Integral of F
00007 C            over (A,B), hopefully satisfying the accuracy claim:
00008 C                 ABS(I-RESULT).LE.MAX(EPSABS,EPSREL*ABS(I)).
00009 C            Break points of the integration interval, where local
00010 C            difficulties of the integrand may occur (e.g. singularities
00011 C            or discontinuities) are provided by the user.
00012 C***LIBRARY   SLATEC (QUADPACK)
00013 C***CATEGORY  H2A2A1
00014 C***TYPE      DOUBLE PRECISION (QAGPE-S, DQAGPE-D)
00015 C***KEYWORDS  AUTOMATIC INTEGRATOR, EXTRAPOLATION, GENERAL-PURPOSE,
00016 C             GLOBALLY ADAPTIVE, QUADPACK, QUADRATURE,
00017 C             SINGULARITIES AT USER SPECIFIED POINTS
00018 C***AUTHOR  Piessens, Robert
00019 C             Applied Mathematics and Programming Division
00020 C             K. U. Leuven
00021 C           de Doncker, Elise
00022 C             Applied Mathematics and Programming Division
00023 C             K. U. Leuven
00024 C***DESCRIPTION
00025 C
00026 C        Computation of a definite integral
00027 C        Standard fortran subroutine
00028 C        Double precision version
00029 C
00030 C        PARAMETERS
00031 C         ON ENTRY
00032 C            F      - Double precision
00033 C                     Function subprogram defining the integrand
00034 C                     function F(X). The actual name for F needs to be
00035 C                     declared E X T E R N A L in the driver program.
00036 C
00037 C            A      - Double precision
00038 C                     Lower limit of integration
00039 C
00040 C            B      - Double precision
00041 C                     Upper limit of integration
00042 C
00043 C            NPTS2  - Integer
00044 C                     Number equal to two more than the number of
00045 C                     user-supplied break points within the integration
00046 C                     range, NPTS2.GE.2.
00047 C                     If NPTS2.LT.2, the routine will end with IER = 6.
00048 C
00049 C            POINTS - Double precision
00050 C                     Vector of dimension NPTS2, the first (NPTS2-2)
00051 C                     elements of which are the user provided break
00052 C                     POINTS. If these POINTS do not constitute an
00053 C                     ascending sequence there will be an automatic
00054 C                     sorting.
00055 C
00056 C            EPSABS - Double precision
00057 C                     Absolute accuracy requested
00058 C            EPSREL - Double precision
00059 C                     Relative accuracy requested
00060 C                     If  EPSABS.LE.0
00061 C                     and EPSREL.LT.MAX(50*REL.MACH.ACC.,0.5D-28),
00062 C                     the routine will end with IER = 6.
00063 C
00064 C            LIMIT  - Integer
00065 C                     Gives an upper bound on the number of subintervals
00066 C                     in the partition of (A,B), LIMIT.GE.NPTS2
00067 C                     If LIMIT.LT.NPTS2, the routine will end with
00068 C                     IER = 6.
00069 C
00070 C         ON RETURN
00071 C            RESULT - Double precision
00072 C                     Approximation to the integral
00073 C
00074 C            ABSERR - Double precision
00075 C                     Estimate of the modulus of the absolute error,
00076 C                     which should equal or exceed ABS(I-RESULT)
00077 C
00078 C            NEVAL  - Integer
00079 C                     Number of integrand evaluations
00080 C
00081 C            IER    - Integer
00082 C                     IER = 0 Normal and reliable termination of the
00083 C                             routine. It is assumed that the requested
00084 C                             accuracy has been achieved.
00085 C                     IER.GT.0 Abnormal termination of the routine.
00086 C                             The estimates for integral and error are
00087 C                             less reliable. It is assumed that the
00088 C                             requested accuracy has not been achieved.
00089 C            ERROR MESSAGES
00090 C                     IER = 1 Maximum number of subdivisions allowed
00091 C                             has been achieved. One can allow more
00092 C                             subdivisions by increasing the value of
00093 C                             LIMIT (and taking the according dimension
00094 C                             adjustments into account). However, if
00095 C                             this yields no improvement it is advised
00096 C                             to analyze the integrand in order to
00097 C                             determine the integration difficulties. If
00098 C                             the position of a local difficulty can be
00099 C                             determined (i.e. SINGULARITY,
00100 C                             DISCONTINUITY within the interval), it
00101 C                             should be supplied to the routine as an
00102 C                             element of the vector points. If necessary
00103 C                             an appropriate special-purpose integrator
00104 C                             must be used, which is designed for
00105 C                             handling the type of difficulty involved.
00106 C                         = 2 The occurrence of roundoff error is
00107 C                             detected, which prevents the requested
00108 C                             tolerance from being achieved.
00109 C                             The error may be under-estimated.
00110 C                         = 3 Extremely bad integrand behaviour occurs
00111 C                             At some points of the integration
00112 C                             interval.
00113 C                         = 4 The algorithm does not converge.
00114 C                             Roundoff error is detected in the
00115 C                             extrapolation table. It is presumed that
00116 C                             the requested tolerance cannot be
00117 C                             achieved, and that the returned result is
00118 C                             the best which can be obtained.
00119 C                         = 5 The integral is probably divergent, or
00120 C                             slowly convergent. It must be noted that
00121 C                             divergence can occur with any other value
00122 C                             of IER.GT.0.
00123 C                         = 6 The input is invalid because
00124 C                             NPTS2.LT.2 or
00125 C                             Break points are specified outside
00126 C                             the integration range or
00127 C                             (EPSABS.LE.0 and
00128 C                              EPSREL.LT.MAX(50*REL.MACH.ACC.,0.5D-28))
00129 C                             or LIMIT.LT.NPTS2.
00130 C                             RESULT, ABSERR, NEVAL, LAST, RLIST(1),
00131 C                             and ELIST(1) are set to zero. ALIST(1) and
00132 C                             BLIST(1) are set to A and B respectively.
00133 C
00134 C            ALIST  - Double precision
00135 C                     Vector of dimension at least LIMIT, the first
00136 C                      LAST  elements of which are the left end points
00137 C                     of the subintervals in the partition of the given
00138 C                     integration range (A,B)
00139 C
00140 C            BLIST  - Double precision
00141 C                     Vector of dimension at least LIMIT, the first
00142 C                      LAST  elements of which are the right end points
00143 C                     of the subintervals in the partition of the given
00144 C                     integration range (A,B)
00145 C
00146 C            RLIST  - Double precision
00147 C                     Vector of dimension at least LIMIT, the first
00148 C                      LAST  elements of which are the integral
00149 C                     approximations on the subintervals
00150 C
00151 C            ELIST  - Double precision
00152 C                     Vector of dimension at least LIMIT, the first
00153 C                      LAST  elements of which are the moduli of the
00154 C                     absolute error estimates on the subintervals
00155 C
00156 C            PTS    - Double precision
00157 C                     Vector of dimension at least NPTS2, containing the
00158 C                     integration limits and the break points of the
00159 C                     interval in ascending sequence.
00160 C
00161 C            LEVEL  - Integer
00162 C                     Vector of dimension at least LIMIT, containing the
00163 C                     subdivision levels of the subinterval, i.e. if
00164 C                     (AA,BB) is a subinterval of (P1,P2) where P1 as
00165 C                     well as P2 is a user-provided break point or
00166 C                     integration limit, then (AA,BB) has level L if
00167 C                     ABS(BB-AA) = ABS(P2-P1)*2**(-L).
00168 C
00169 C            NDIN   - Integer
00170 C                     Vector of dimension at least NPTS2, after first
00171 C                     integration over the intervals (PTS(I)),PTS(I+1),
00172 C                     I = 0,1, ..., NPTS2-2, the error estimates over
00173 C                     some of the intervals may have been increased
00174 C                     artificially, in order to put their subdivision
00175 C                     forward. If this happens for the subinterval
00176 C                     numbered K, NDIN(K) is put to 1, otherwise
00177 C                     NDIN(K) = 0.
00178 C
00179 C            IORD   - Integer
00180 C                     Vector of dimension at least LIMIT, the first K
00181 C                     elements of which are pointers to the
00182 C                     error estimates over the subintervals,
00183 C                     such that ELIST(IORD(1)), ..., ELIST(IORD(K))
00184 C                     form a decreasing sequence, with K = LAST
00185 C                     If LAST.LE.(LIMIT/2+2), and K = LIMIT+1-LAST
00186 C                     otherwise
00187 C
00188 C            LAST   - Integer
00189 C                     Number of subintervals actually produced in the
00190 C                     subdivisions process
00191 C
00192 C***REFERENCES  (NONE)
00193 C***ROUTINES CALLED  D1MACH, DQELG, DQK21, DQPSRT
00194 C***REVISION HISTORY  (YYMMDD)
00195 C   800101  DATE WRITTEN
00196 C   890531  Changed all specific intrinsics to generic.  (WRB)
00197 C   890831  Modified array declarations.  (WRB)
00198 C   890831  REVISION DATE from Version 3.2
00199 C   891214  Prologue converted to Version 4.0 format.  (BAB)
00200 C***END PROLOGUE  DQAGPE
00201       DOUBLE PRECISION A,ABSEPS,ABSERR,ALIST,AREA,AREA1,AREA12,AREA2,A1,
00202      1  A2,B,BLIST,B1,B2,CORREC,DEFABS,DEFAB1,DEFAB2,
00203      2  DRES,D1MACH,ELIST,EPMACH,EPSABS,EPSREL,ERLARG,ERLAST,ERRBND,
00204      3  ERRMAX,ERROR1,ERRO12,ERROR2,ERRSUM,ERTEST,F,OFLOW,POINTS,PTS,
00205      4  RESA,RESABS,RESEPS,RESULT,RES3LA,RLIST,RLIST2,SIGN,TEMP,UFLOW
00206       INTEGER I,ID,IER,IERRO,IND1,IND2,IORD,IP1,IROFF1,IROFF2,IROFF3,J,
00207      1  JLOW,JUPBND,K,KSGN,KTMIN,LAST,LEVCUR,LEVEL,LEVMAX,LIMIT,MAXERR,
00208      2  NDIN,NEVAL,NINT,NINTP1,NPTS,NPTS2,NRES,NRMAX,NUMRL2
00209       LOGICAL EXTRAP,NOEXT
00210 C
00211 C
00212       DIMENSION ALIST(*),BLIST(*),ELIST(*),IORD(*),
00213      1  LEVEL(*),NDIN(*),POINTS(*),PTS(*),RES3LA(3),
00214      2  RLIST(*),RLIST2(52)
00215 C
00216       EXTERNAL F
00217 C
00218 C            THE DIMENSION OF RLIST2 IS DETERMINED BY THE VALUE OF
00219 C            LIMEXP IN SUBROUTINE EPSALG (RLIST2 SHOULD BE OF DIMENSION
00220 C            (LIMEXP+2) AT LEAST).
00221 C
00222 C
00223 C            LIST OF MAJOR VARIABLES
00224 C            -----------------------
00225 C
00226 C           ALIST     - LIST OF LEFT END POINTS OF ALL SUBINTERVALS
00227 C                       CONSIDERED UP TO NOW
00228 C           BLIST     - LIST OF RIGHT END POINTS OF ALL SUBINTERVALS
00229 C                       CONSIDERED UP TO NOW
00230 C           RLIST(I)  - APPROXIMATION TO THE INTEGRAL OVER
00231 C                       (ALIST(I),BLIST(I))
00232 C           RLIST2    - ARRAY OF DIMENSION AT LEAST LIMEXP+2
00233 C                       CONTAINING THE PART OF THE EPSILON TABLE WHICH
00234 C                       IS STILL NEEDED FOR FURTHER COMPUTATIONS
00235 C           ELIST(I)  - ERROR ESTIMATE APPLYING TO RLIST(I)
00236 C           MAXERR    - POINTER TO THE INTERVAL WITH LARGEST ERROR
00237 C                       ESTIMATE
00238 C           ERRMAX    - ELIST(MAXERR)
00239 C           ERLAST    - ERROR ON THE INTERVAL CURRENTLY SUBDIVIDED
00240 C                       (BEFORE THAT SUBDIVISION HAS TAKEN PLACE)
00241 C           AREA      - SUM OF THE INTEGRALS OVER THE SUBINTERVALS
00242 C           ERRSUM    - SUM OF THE ERRORS OVER THE SUBINTERVALS
00243 C           ERRBND    - REQUESTED ACCURACY MAX(EPSABS,EPSREL*
00244 C                       ABS(RESULT))
00245 C           *****1    - VARIABLE FOR THE LEFT SUBINTERVAL
00246 C           *****2    - VARIABLE FOR THE RIGHT SUBINTERVAL
00247 C           LAST      - INDEX FOR SUBDIVISION
00248 C           NRES      - NUMBER OF CALLS TO THE EXTRAPOLATION ROUTINE
00249 C           NUMRL2    - NUMBER OF ELEMENTS IN RLIST2. IF AN APPROPRIATE
00250 C                       APPROXIMATION TO THE COMPOUNDED INTEGRAL HAS
00251 C                       BEEN OBTAINED, IT IS PUT IN RLIST2(NUMRL2) AFTER
00252 C                       NUMRL2 HAS BEEN INCREASED BY ONE.
00253 C           ERLARG    - SUM OF THE ERRORS OVER THE INTERVALS LARGER
00254 C                       THAN THE SMALLEST INTERVAL CONSIDERED UP TO NOW
00255 C           EXTRAP    - LOGICAL VARIABLE DENOTING THAT THE ROUTINE
00256 C                       IS ATTEMPTING TO PERFORM EXTRAPOLATION. I.E.
00257 C                       BEFORE SUBDIVIDING THE SMALLEST INTERVAL WE
00258 C                       TRY TO DECREASE THE VALUE OF ERLARG.
00259 C           NOEXT     - LOGICAL VARIABLE DENOTING THAT EXTRAPOLATION IS
00260 C                       NO LONGER ALLOWED (TRUE-VALUE)
00261 C
00262 C            MACHINE DEPENDENT CONSTANTS
00263 C            ---------------------------
00264 C
00265 C           EPMACH IS THE LARGEST RELATIVE SPACING.
00266 C           UFLOW IS THE SMALLEST POSITIVE MAGNITUDE.
00267 C           OFLOW IS THE LARGEST POSITIVE MAGNITUDE.
00268 C
00269 C***FIRST EXECUTABLE STATEMENT  DQAGPE
00270       EPMACH = D1MACH(4)
00271 C
00272 C            TEST ON VALIDITY OF PARAMETERS
00273 C            -----------------------------
00274 C
00275       IER = 0
00276       NEVAL = 0
00277       LAST = 0
00278       RESULT = 0.0D+00
00279       ABSERR = 0.0D+00
00280       ALIST(1) = A
00281       BLIST(1) = B
00282       RLIST(1) = 0.0D+00
00283       ELIST(1) = 0.0D+00
00284       IORD(1) = 0
00285       LEVEL(1) = 0
00286       NPTS = NPTS2-2
00287       IF(NPTS2.LT.2.OR.LIMIT.LE.NPTS.OR.(EPSABS.LE.0.0D+00.AND.
00288      1  EPSREL.LT.MAX(0.5D+02*EPMACH,0.5D-28))) IER = 6
00289       IF(IER.EQ.6) GO TO 999
00290 C
00291 C            IF ANY BREAK POINTS ARE PROVIDED, SORT THEM INTO AN
00292 C            ASCENDING SEQUENCE.
00293 C
00294       SIGN = 1.0D+00
00295       IF(A.GT.B) SIGN = -1.0D+00
00296       PTS(1) = MIN(A,B)
00297       IF(NPTS.EQ.0) GO TO 15
00298       DO 10 I = 1,NPTS
00299         PTS(I+1) = POINTS(I)
00300    10 CONTINUE
00301    15 PTS(NPTS+2) = MAX(A,B)
00302       NINT = NPTS+1
00303       A1 = PTS(1)
00304       IF(NPTS.EQ.0) GO TO 40
00305       NINTP1 = NINT+1
00306       DO 20 I = 1,NINT
00307         IP1 = I+1
00308         DO 20 J = IP1,NINTP1
00309           IF(PTS(I).LE.PTS(J)) GO TO 20
00310           TEMP = PTS(I)
00311           PTS(I) = PTS(J)
00312           PTS(J) = TEMP
00313    20 CONTINUE
00314       IF(PTS(1).NE.MIN(A,B).OR.PTS(NINTP1).NE.MAX(A,B)) IER = 6
00315       IF(IER.EQ.6) GO TO 999
00316 C
00317 C            COMPUTE FIRST INTEGRAL AND ERROR APPROXIMATIONS.
00318 C            ------------------------------------------------
00319 C
00320    40 RESABS = 0.0D+00
00321       DO 50 I = 1,NINT
00322         B1 = PTS(I+1)
00323         CALL DQK21(F,A1,B1,AREA1,ERROR1,DEFABS,RESA)
00324         ABSERR = ABSERR+ERROR1
00325         RESULT = RESULT+AREA1
00326         NDIN(I) = 0
00327         IF(ERROR1.EQ.RESA.AND.ERROR1.NE.0.0D+00) NDIN(I) = 1
00328         RESABS = RESABS+DEFABS
00329         LEVEL(I) = 0
00330         ELIST(I) = ERROR1
00331         ALIST(I) = A1
00332         BLIST(I) = B1
00333         RLIST(I) = AREA1
00334         IORD(I) = I
00335         A1 = B1
00336    50 CONTINUE
00337       ERRSUM = 0.0D+00
00338       DO 55 I = 1,NINT
00339         IF(NDIN(I).EQ.1) ELIST(I) = ABSERR
00340         ERRSUM = ERRSUM+ELIST(I)
00341    55 CONTINUE
00342 C
00343 C           TEST ON ACCURACY.
00344 C
00345       LAST = NINT
00346       NEVAL = 21*NINT
00347       DRES = ABS(RESULT)
00348       ERRBND = MAX(EPSABS,EPSREL*DRES)
00349       IF(ABSERR.LE.0.1D+03*EPMACH*RESABS.AND.ABSERR.GT.ERRBND) IER = 2
00350       IF(NINT.EQ.1) GO TO 80
00351       DO 70 I = 1,NPTS
00352         JLOW = I+1
00353         IND1 = IORD(I)
00354         DO 60 J = JLOW,NINT
00355           IND2 = IORD(J)
00356           IF(ELIST(IND1).GT.ELIST(IND2)) GO TO 60
00357           IND1 = IND2
00358           K = J
00359    60   CONTINUE
00360         IF(IND1.EQ.IORD(I)) GO TO 70
00361         IORD(K) = IORD(I)
00362         IORD(I) = IND1
00363    70 CONTINUE
00364       IF(LIMIT.LT.NPTS2) IER = 1
00365    80 IF(IER.NE.0.OR.ABSERR.LE.ERRBND) GO TO 999
00366 C
00367 C           INITIALIZATION
00368 C           --------------
00369 C
00370       RLIST2(1) = RESULT
00371       MAXERR = IORD(1)
00372       ERRMAX = ELIST(MAXERR)
00373       AREA = RESULT
00374       NRMAX = 1
00375       NRES = 0
00376       NUMRL2 = 1
00377       KTMIN = 0
00378       EXTRAP = .FALSE.
00379       NOEXT = .FALSE.
00380       ERLARG = ERRSUM
00381       ERTEST = ERRBND
00382       LEVMAX = 1
00383       IROFF1 = 0
00384       IROFF2 = 0
00385       IROFF3 = 0
00386       IERRO = 0
00387       UFLOW = D1MACH(1)
00388       OFLOW = D1MACH(2)
00389       ABSERR = OFLOW
00390       KSGN = -1
00391       IF(DRES.GE.(0.1D+01-0.5D+02*EPMACH)*RESABS) KSGN = 1
00392 C
00393 C           MAIN DO-LOOP
00394 C           ------------
00395 C
00396       DO 160 LAST = NPTS2,LIMIT
00397 C
00398 C           BISECT THE SUBINTERVAL WITH THE NRMAX-TH LARGEST ERROR
00399 C           ESTIMATE.
00400 C
00401         LEVCUR = LEVEL(MAXERR)+1
00402         A1 = ALIST(MAXERR)
00403         B1 = 0.5D+00*(ALIST(MAXERR)+BLIST(MAXERR))
00404         A2 = B1
00405         B2 = BLIST(MAXERR)
00406         ERLAST = ERRMAX
00407         CALL DQK21(F,A1,B1,AREA1,ERROR1,RESA,DEFAB1)
00408         CALL DQK21(F,A2,B2,AREA2,ERROR2,RESA,DEFAB2)
00409 C
00410 C           IMPROVE PREVIOUS APPROXIMATIONS TO INTEGRAL
00411 C           AND ERROR AND TEST FOR ACCURACY.
00412 C
00413         NEVAL = NEVAL+42
00414         AREA12 = AREA1+AREA2
00415         ERRO12 = ERROR1+ERROR2
00416         ERRSUM = ERRSUM+ERRO12-ERRMAX
00417         AREA = AREA+AREA12-RLIST(MAXERR)
00418         IF(DEFAB1.EQ.ERROR1.OR.DEFAB2.EQ.ERROR2) GO TO 95
00419         IF(ABS(RLIST(MAXERR)-AREA12).GT.0.1D-04*ABS(AREA12)
00420      1  .OR.ERRO12.LT.0.99D+00*ERRMAX) GO TO 90
00421         IF(EXTRAP) IROFF2 = IROFF2+1
00422         IF(.NOT.EXTRAP) IROFF1 = IROFF1+1
00423    90   IF(LAST.GT.10.AND.ERRO12.GT.ERRMAX) IROFF3 = IROFF3+1
00424    95   LEVEL(MAXERR) = LEVCUR
00425         LEVEL(LAST) = LEVCUR
00426         RLIST(MAXERR) = AREA1
00427         RLIST(LAST) = AREA2
00428         ERRBND = MAX(EPSABS,EPSREL*ABS(AREA))
00429 C
00430 C           TEST FOR ROUNDOFF ERROR AND EVENTUALLY SET ERROR FLAG.
00431 C
00432         IF(IROFF1+IROFF2.GE.10.OR.IROFF3.GE.20) IER = 2
00433         IF(IROFF2.GE.5) IERRO = 3
00434 C
00435 C           SET ERROR FLAG IN THE CASE THAT THE NUMBER OF
00436 C           SUBINTERVALS EQUALS LIMIT.
00437 C
00438         IF(LAST.EQ.LIMIT) IER = 1
00439 C
00440 C           SET ERROR FLAG IN THE CASE OF BAD INTEGRAND BEHAVIOUR
00441 C           AT A POINT OF THE INTEGRATION RANGE
00442 C
00443         IF(MAX(ABS(A1),ABS(B2)).LE.(0.1D+01+0.1D+03*EPMACH)*
00444      1  (ABS(A2)+0.1D+04*UFLOW)) IER = 4
00445 C
00446 C           APPEND THE NEWLY-CREATED INTERVALS TO THE LIST.
00447 C
00448         IF(ERROR2.GT.ERROR1) GO TO 100
00449         ALIST(LAST) = A2
00450         BLIST(MAXERR) = B1
00451         BLIST(LAST) = B2
00452         ELIST(MAXERR) = ERROR1
00453         ELIST(LAST) = ERROR2
00454         GO TO 110
00455   100   ALIST(MAXERR) = A2
00456         ALIST(LAST) = A1
00457         BLIST(LAST) = B1
00458         RLIST(MAXERR) = AREA2
00459         RLIST(LAST) = AREA1
00460         ELIST(MAXERR) = ERROR2
00461         ELIST(LAST) = ERROR1
00462 C
00463 C           CALL SUBROUTINE DQPSRT TO MAINTAIN THE DESCENDING ORDERING
00464 C           IN THE LIST OF ERROR ESTIMATES AND SELECT THE SUBINTERVAL
00465 C           WITH NRMAX-TH LARGEST ERROR ESTIMATE (TO BE BISECTED NEXT).
00466 C
00467   110   CALL DQPSRT(LIMIT,LAST,MAXERR,ERRMAX,ELIST,IORD,NRMAX)
00468 C ***JUMP OUT OF DO-LOOP
00469         IF(ERRSUM.LE.ERRBND) GO TO 190
00470 C ***JUMP OUT OF DO-LOOP
00471         IF(IER.NE.0) GO TO 170
00472         IF(NOEXT) GO TO 160
00473         ERLARG = ERLARG-ERLAST
00474         IF(LEVCUR+1.LE.LEVMAX) ERLARG = ERLARG+ERRO12
00475         IF(EXTRAP) GO TO 120
00476 C
00477 C           TEST WHETHER THE INTERVAL TO BE BISECTED NEXT IS THE
00478 C           SMALLEST INTERVAL.
00479 C
00480         IF(LEVEL(MAXERR)+1.LE.LEVMAX) GO TO 160
00481         EXTRAP = .TRUE.
00482         NRMAX = 2
00483   120   IF(IERRO.EQ.3.OR.ERLARG.LE.ERTEST) GO TO 140
00484 C
00485 C           THE SMALLEST INTERVAL HAS THE LARGEST ERROR.
00486 C           BEFORE BISECTING DECREASE THE SUM OF THE ERRORS OVER
00487 C           THE LARGER INTERVALS (ERLARG) AND PERFORM EXTRAPOLATION.
00488 C
00489         ID = NRMAX
00490         JUPBND = LAST
00491         IF(LAST.GT.(2+LIMIT/2)) JUPBND = LIMIT+3-LAST
00492         DO 130 K = ID,JUPBND
00493           MAXERR = IORD(NRMAX)
00494           ERRMAX = ELIST(MAXERR)
00495 C ***JUMP OUT OF DO-LOOP
00496           IF(LEVEL(MAXERR)+1.LE.LEVMAX) GO TO 160
00497           NRMAX = NRMAX+1
00498   130   CONTINUE
00499 C
00500 C           PERFORM EXTRAPOLATION.
00501 C
00502   140   NUMRL2 = NUMRL2+1
00503         RLIST2(NUMRL2) = AREA
00504         IF(NUMRL2.LE.2) GO TO 155
00505         CALL DQELG(NUMRL2,RLIST2,RESEPS,ABSEPS,RES3LA,NRES)
00506         KTMIN = KTMIN+1
00507         IF(KTMIN.GT.5.AND.ABSERR.LT.0.1D-02*ERRSUM) IER = 5
00508         IF(ABSEPS.GE.ABSERR) GO TO 150
00509         KTMIN = 0
00510         ABSERR = ABSEPS
00511         RESULT = RESEPS
00512         CORREC = ERLARG
00513         ERTEST = MAX(EPSABS,EPSREL*ABS(RESEPS))
00514 C ***JUMP OUT OF DO-LOOP
00515         IF(ABSERR.LT.ERTEST) GO TO 170
00516 C
00517 C           PREPARE BISECTION OF THE SMALLEST INTERVAL.
00518 C
00519   150   IF(NUMRL2.EQ.1) NOEXT = .TRUE.
00520         IF(IER.GE.5) GO TO 170
00521   155   MAXERR = IORD(1)
00522         ERRMAX = ELIST(MAXERR)
00523         NRMAX = 1
00524         EXTRAP = .FALSE.
00525         LEVMAX = LEVMAX+1
00526         ERLARG = ERRSUM
00527   160 CONTINUE
00528 C
00529 C           SET THE FINAL RESULT.
00530 C           ---------------------
00531 C
00532 C
00533   170 IF(ABSERR.EQ.OFLOW) GO TO 190
00534       IF((IER+IERRO).EQ.0) GO TO 180
00535       IF(IERRO.EQ.3) ABSERR = ABSERR+CORREC
00536       IF(IER.EQ.0) IER = 3
00537       IF(RESULT.NE.0.0D+00.AND.AREA.NE.0.0D+00)GO TO 175
00538       IF(ABSERR.GT.ERRSUM)GO TO 190
00539       IF(AREA.EQ.0.0D+00) GO TO 210
00540       GO TO 180
00541   175 IF(ABSERR/ABS(RESULT).GT.ERRSUM/ABS(AREA))GO TO 190
00542 C
00543 C           TEST ON DIVERGENCE.
00544 C
00545   180 IF(KSGN.EQ.(-1).AND.MAX(ABS(RESULT),ABS(AREA)).LE.
00546      1  DEFABS*0.1D-01) GO TO 210
00547       IF(0.1D-01.GT.(RESULT/AREA).OR.(RESULT/AREA).GT.0.1D+03.OR.
00548      1  ERRSUM.GT.ABS(AREA)) IER = 6
00549       GO TO 210
00550 C
00551 C           COMPUTE GLOBAL INTEGRAL SUM.
00552 C
00553   190 RESULT = 0.0D+00
00554       DO 200 K = 1,LAST
00555         RESULT = RESULT+RLIST(K)
00556   200 CONTINUE
00557       ABSERR = ERRSUM
00558   210 IF(IER.GT.2) IER = IER-1
00559       RESULT = RESULT*SIGN
00560   999 RETURN
00561       END
00562
